original_title: Aussies reveal squad for three-game T20I series in Pakistan

enhanced_data.enhanced_title: Australia Announce Star-Studded 17-Player Squad for Pakistan T20I Series Ahead of T20 World Cup 2026
enhanced_data.seo_meta_description: Australia name 17-player T20I squad for Pakistan series in Lahore. Mitchell Marsh to captain as Cummins, Maxwell rest ahead of T20 World Cup 2026.
enhanced_data.full_blog_post_markdown:
## Australia Unveil 17-Player Squad for Pakistan T20I Series

Australia have announced a formidable 17-player squad for their upcoming three-match T20I series against Pakistan, set to serve as crucial preparation ahead of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026.

The series will be held entirely at Gaddafi Stadium in Lahore, with matches scheduled across four days beginning January 29, followed by fixtures on January 31 and February 1.

### Leadership and Key Inclusions

Experienced all-rounder **Mitchell Marsh** will captain the side, bringing his leadership expertise to guide a blend of seasoned internationals and emerging talent. The squad features several players fresh from Australia's recent Ashes series against England, including the dynamic **Travis Head**, versatile **Cameron Green**, and wicketkeeper-batter **Josh Inglis**.

### Notable Absences: Load Management in Focus

Several high-profile names will not travel to Pakistan as Cricket Australia prioritises player welfare ahead of the World Cup. **Pat Cummins**, **Josh Hazlewood**, **Glenn Maxwell**, **Nathan Ellis**, and **Tim David** have all been rested, with Cummins, Hazlewood, and David continuing to build fitness following respective injuries.

### Fresh Faces Earn Selection

The squad includes exciting new additions following standout performances in the Big Bash League. **Sean Abbott**, **Mahli Beardman**, **Ben Dwarshuis**, **Jack Edwards**, **Mitch Owen**, **Josh Philippe**, and **Matt Renshaw** have all earned call-ups as cover options.

Young fast bowler Beardman and rising star Edwards have capitalised on breakout BBL campaigns. While both remain uncapped at international level, they gained valuable experience with the Australian squad during the India series earlier this summer.

### Selector's Assessment

Australia's Chair of Selectors **George Bailey** emphasised the developmental importance of the tour:

> "The series is a great opportunity for those on the brink of selection and some young players we rate highly for valuable experience with the World Cup group in Pakistan. Some are already experienced international players (while) Mahli Beardman has been with the group a number of times and Jack Edwards joined (the squad) for the last one-day match against India in Sydney last year."

### BBL Commitments to Be Honoured

Players still competing in the Big Bash League finals will join the squad once their respective franchise campaigns conclude, ensuring Australia can call upon their full contingent as the series progresses.

### Full Australian Squad

**Captain:** Mitchell Marsh

**Squad Members:** Sean Abbott, Xavier Bartlett, Mahli Beardman, Cooper Connolly, Ben Dwarshuis, Jack Edwards, Cameron Green, Travis Head, Josh Inglis, Matthew Kuhnemann, Mitch Owen, Josh Philippe, Matthew Renshaw, Matt Short, Marcus Stoinis, Adam Zampa

### Series Schedule

| Match | Date | Venue |
|-------|------|-------|
| 1st T20I | January 29, 2026 | Gaddafi Stadium, Lahore |
| 2nd T20I | January 31, 2026 | Gaddafi Stadium, Lahore |
| 3rd T20I | February 1, 2026 | Gaddafi Stadium, Lahore |

### Looking Ahead to the T20 World Cup

This Pakistan series represents Australia's final international assignment before the T20 World Cup 2026. The tour provides selectors with a valuable opportunity to assess squad depth, give match practice to fringe players, and fine-tune combinations ahead of the global showpiece event.

With a healthy mix of experience and youth, Australia will be keen to build momentum while carefully managing their star players for the challenges ahead.
